alert.note: Alert for Shasta; Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 12:45PM PDT until September 01 at 3:15PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Shasta and Tehama. * WHEN...Until 615 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1242 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Redding Metro Area including portions of Interstate 5, Highway 273 and 299. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redding, Shasta Dam, Palo Cedro, Shasta Lake, Anderson, Keswick, Centerville, Olinda, Central Valley, Central Valley Cdp, Igo, Whiskeytown, Mountain Gate, Ono, Millville, French Gulch and Cottonwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
